item.title: Three-dimensional genome restructuring across timescales of activity-induced neuronal gene expression
item.description:
Jonathan A. Beagan, Elissa D. Pastuzyn, Lindsey R. Fernandez, Michael H. Guo, Kelly Feng, Katelyn R. Titus, Harshini Chandrashekar, Jason D. Shepherd, Jennifer E. Phillips-Cremins

Neuronal activation induces rapid transcription of immediate early genes (IEGs) and longer-term chromatin remodeling around secondary response genes (SRGs). Here, we use high-resolution chromosome-conformation-capture carbon-copy sequencing (5C-seq) to elucidate the extent to which long-range chromatin loops are altered during short- and long-term changes in neural activity. item.title: MATCHA: Probing Multi-way Chromatin Interaction with Hypergraph Representation Learning
item.description:
Ruochi Zhang, Jian Ma

[...] Here, we develop an algorithm called MATCHA, based on hypergraph representation learning, where multi-way chromatin interactions are represented as hyperedges. Applications to SPRITE and ChIA-Drop data suggest that MATCHA is effective to denoise the data and make de novo predictions, which greatly enhances the data quality for analyzing the properties of multi-way chromatin interactions. item.title: Distinct features of nucleolus-associated domains in mouse embryonic stem cells
item.description:
Aizhan Bizhanova, Aimin Yan, Jun Yu, Lihua Julie Zhu, Paul D. Kaufman

Heterochromatin in eukaryotic interphase cells frequently localizes to the nucleolar periphery (nucleolus-associated domains (NADs)) and the nuclear lamina (lamina-associated domains (LADs)). Gene expression in somatic cell NADs is generally low, but NADs have not been characterized in mammalian stem cells.
